603.quoteText: Google may also stop providing Services to you, or add or create new limits to our Services at any time.
603.title: Google may stop providing services to you at any time

tosdr.case: They may stop providing the service at any time
tosdr.tldr: “Google may also stop providing Services to you, or add or create new limits to our Services at any time.” Google has no obligation from the terms to give you notice in advance or to give a reason for that termination

612.quoteText: The rights you grant in this license are for the limited purpose of operating, promoting, and improving our Services, and to develop new ones.
612.title: Google can use your content for all their existing and future services

tosdr.case: This service can use your content for all their existing and future services
tosdr.tldr: The content you post on a particular Google service can be used by Google on other services you may not be aware of.

617.quoteText:
We do not share your personal information with companies, organizations, or individuals outside of Google except in the following cases:

With your consent

We’ll share personal information outside of Google when we have your consent. For example, if you use Google Home to request a ride from a ride-sharing service, we’ll get your permission before sharing your address with that service. We’ll ask for your explicit consent to share any sensitive personal information.
617.title: Google can share your personal information with other parties

tosdr.case: This service can share your personal information to third parties
tosdr.tldr: Google can share your personal information with other parties. For sensitive information (medical, racial, ethnic, political, religious or sexuality) Google requires “opt-in”. Google can also share or publish aggregated data that does not identify a person

783.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA
783.quoteText:
This license continues even if you stop using our Services (for example, for a business listing you have added to Google Maps).
Some Services may offer you ways to access and remove content that has been provided to that Service.
Also, in some of our Services, there are terms or settings that narrow the scope of our use of the content submitted in those Services.
783.title: Google keeps the rights on your content when you stop using it

tosdr.case: This service retains rights to your content even after you stop using your account
tosdr.tldr: The license that you grant to Google on content you upload to their services will continue even if you stop using the services. While this makes sense for some services (e.g. Google Maps) this applies by default to all Google services. Otherwise you need to check each service for ways to remove content and for specific clauses that restrict the license in time.

856.quoteText: We always indicate the date the last changes were published
856.title: There is a date of the last update of the terms

tosdr.case: There is a date of the last update of the terms

tosdr.case: This service provides archives of their terms of service so that changes can be viewed over time
tosdr.tldr: At http://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/terms/archive/ you can see at least one previous versions of Google's terms

1088.quoteText: The laws of California, U.S.A., excluding California’s conflict of laws rules, will apply to any disputes arising out of or relating to these terms or the Services.
1088.title: Jurisdiction in California

tosdr.case: The court of law governing the terms is in location X
tosdr.tldr: “The laws of California, U.S.A., excluding California’s conflict of laws rules, will apply to any disputes arising out of or relating to these terms or the Services.All claims arising out of or relating to these terms or the Services will be litigated exclusively in the federal or state courts of Santa Clara County, California, USA, and you and Google consent to personal jurisdiction in those courts.”

1104.quoteText: When you upload, submit, store, send or receive content to or through our Services, you give Google (and those we work with) a worldwide license to use, host, store, reproduce, modify, create derivative works (such as those resulting from translations, adaptations or other changes we make so that your content works better with our Services), communicate, publish, publicly perform, publicly display and distribute such content.
1104.title: Limited copyright license to operate and improve all Google Services

tosdr.case: The copyright license that users grant this service is limited to the parties that make up the service's broader platform.
tosdr.tldr: The copyright license you grant is “for the limited purpose of operating, promoting, and improving” existing and new Google Services. However, please note that the license does not end if you stop using the Google services.

1141.quoteText: When you’re not signed in to a Google Account, we store the information we collect with unique identifiers tied to the browser, application, or device you’re using.
1141.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
tosdr.tldr: "We collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information including phone number). Google may associate your device identifiers or phone number with your Google Account."

1598.quoteText: The information we collect includes unique identifiers, browser type and settings, device type and settings, operating system, mobile network information including carrier name and phone number, and application version number.
1598.title: Google may collect your device fingerprint.

tosdr.tldr: "We collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information including phone number). Google may associate your device identifiers or phone number with your Google Account."

2142.quoteText: When we detect spam, malware, illegal content, and other forms of abuse on our systems in violation of our policies, we may disable your account or take other appropriate action.
2142.title: Users agree not to use the service for illegal purposes

tosdr.case: Users agree not to use the service for illegal purposes
tosdr.tldr:
EN (quote) : > Do not use our Services improperly.
FR (quote) : > N’utilisez pas nos Services de façon impropre.
